bibl.title: Thomas Allen v. John H. McGraw. Committment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
United States of America Territory of Washington King County ss
To the Sheriff or any Constable, & the keeper of the jail of said King County Whereas at a Justice Court, held at my offices in said county for the examination of Thos. Allen the said Thos. Allen being charged with the crime of Burglary & in having been adjudged & determined by the Court that then is probable comes to charge Thos Allen defendant therein with the Crime of Burglary & that said Thos Allen be held to await the detion of the Grand Jury of said King County in the District Court of the Third Judicial District holding terms at Seattle on the first day of the next term thereof with bail fixed at the sum of $1000 & whereas the said Thos. Allen has made default in said bail in said court.

Therefore you the said John Callurn are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convery & deliver the said Thos Allen to the said Keeper from the said Keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said

Thos Allen into your custody in said jail & him there to until released by said District COurt or under said Bail by tomorrow forwithed Dated the 1st day of Feb. 1889. H. F. Jones Justice of the Peace Seattle Precinct, King County Washington Territory

E 6739 T In the Application of Thos Allen for Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED APR 18 1889 W. E. Ledgerwood Clerk. By Deputy Clerk
E. C. Million atty for Petitioner
